en: He had to feed his large family.
He works hard to support his large family.
He worked hard to support a large family.
He has a big family.
He's got a large family.
He called together everyone who was a captain and above.

en: He has great enthusiasm.
He's a big liar.
He has great enthusiasm for golf.
He is not much of a companion for his wife.
ko: 걔 부인한테는 별로 좋은 남편이 아니야.

en: He'll never amount to much.
ko: 걔는 절대 크게 될 인물은 아니야.

en: He may just be ahead of his time.
ko: 걔가 그냥 시대를 앞서간 걸지도 몰라.

en: He's not much as a singer.
I don't think much of him as a musician.
He banged a big book on the desk.
ko: 걔가 두꺼운 책을 책상에 쾅 내려놨어.

en: He was holding a large box in his arms.
ko: 걔 커다란 상자를 품에 안고 있었어.

en: He is laboring under a great error.
ko: 걔 아주 큰 착각을 하고 있어.

en: He arrived in a big car.
He works in a big city hospital.

en: He succeeded in the face of great difficulties.
He succeeded in the face of great danger.
He was taken on by a large firm as a clerk.
He came bearing a large bunch of flowers.
He has a large house and two cars.

en: He has a lot of ideas about running foreign workers.

en: He landed a big trout.

en: He satisfied his thirst with a large glass of beer.

en: He yawned heavily.
He took a deep breath and tried to put his uneasiness to rest.

en: He grew up to be a college football player.

en: He grew up to be a doctor.

en: He is going to be a doctor when he grows up.
He exerted himself and made his way in life.
He yawned widely.
He's running for Congress.

en: He ran the risk of being caught and imprisoned.
ko: 걔 잡혀서 감옥에 갈 위험을 무릅썼어.

en: He proposed an alternate plan.
I guessed that he was an ex-serviceman.
He took up gardening after he retired.

en: He carries a bag on his back.
He is coarse in manner.
He is a lazy student.

ko: 걔는 게으르고 무책임했어. 그래서 회사에서 나가라는 소리를 들었어.

en: He regrets having been lazy.
He is very hard on lazy people.
He was fired on the grounds that he was lazy.
He's too lazy to apply himself to anything.
ko: 너무 게을러서 아무것도 제대로 안 해요.

en: He's not lazy. On the contrary, I think he's a hard worker.
He was dismissed of the grounds that he was idle.
He was dismissed on the grounds that he was lazy.
He is a lazy fellow.
He is inclined to be lazy.
He idles away the time.
He looked around the waiting room.
He regretted having been idle.

en: He deliberately kept on provoking a confrontation.

He had taken care of himself.

en: He has a high batting average.

He's busier than Taro.

He is Taro's brother.

He has twice flown the Pacific.

He was large, not to say fat.

He has a thick neck.

en: He was so busy that he sent his son instead of going himself.
ko: 너무 바빠서 직접 안 가고 아들을 보냈어요.

en: He was busy, and yet he came to help us.
He could be in the gymnasium.
He is not likely to succeed.
He will probably fail.

He traveled with a large escort.

en: He understands her problems more or less.

en: He has some knowledge of editing.
He was somewhat excited.
He is more or less drunk.
He was more or less drunk.
He has a lot of hobbies.
He has run up large debts.

en: He deposited a lot of money in the bank.

en: He is not a man to deal with a lot of problems.

en: He broke through many problems easily.

en: He is superior to me in many respects.

en: He is well spoken of by many people.

ko: 걔는 사람들 많이 보는 데서 축구하는 걸 좋아해요.

en: He is confronted by many difficulties.

ko: 걔는 여러 장애물에도 불구하고 그 일을 해냈어요.

en: He received a lot of praise.
He devoted much time to study.

en: He had to undergo many trials.

en: He threw away a bunch of old letters.

en: He was exposed to many dangers.

en: A lot of troubles preyed upon his mind.

en: He has no more than five English books.

en: He has not more than a hundred novels.

en: He can dish it out, but he can't take it.

en: He is above deceiving others.

en: He is apt to ridicule others.

en: He invades the privacy of others.

en: He behaved himself so as not to give offence to others.

en: He says what he thinks regardless of other people's feelings.

en: He pays no attention to others' feelings.

en: He is not the sort of man who counts on others for help.

en: He makes it a rule never to speak ill of others.

en: He was willing to work for others.

en: He's not the kind of person who finds fault with others.

en: He's not the kind of person who always criticizes others.

en: He has little feeling for others.

en: He told me to be kind to others.

en: It is not in his nature to be hard on other people.

en: He promised not to tell.

en: He was the scorn of the other boys.

en: He is better than anyone else.

en: He is working hard to catch up with the others.

en: He is taller than any other boy.

en: He's got more books than all the others put together.

en: He is preoccupied with something else.

en: He is bigger than all the other boys.

en: He works as hard as any other student.

en: He is said to have been the richest man in the village.

en: He asked the first person he met near the village.

en: He will make amends for the damage.

en: After graduation he will engage himself in study.

en: He touched the water with his foot.

en: He is slow of foot.

He was unsteady on his feet.

en: He was out of breath.
He settled his property on his sons.

en: He takes pride in his son.

en: He set his son up as a baker.

ko: 아들한테 자기가 아는 걸 다 전수해줬어.

en: He has transmitted all his knowledge to his son.

For all his cleverness, he is always reluctant to give his views.
ko: 똑똑하긴 한데, 자기 의견을 말하는 건 항상 꺼려해요.

en: I believe him to be intelligent.
He aspired to the position of Prime Minister.
He firmly refused the Premier's earnest request.
He kept the window closed.
He kept all the windows open.
He denies having broken the window.
ko: 걔 자기가 창문 깬 거 아니라고 부인해.

en: He tried to open the window.
He slept with the window open.
He hammered at the window.
He looked out of the window.
He came in through the window.
He went out the window.
He was looking out the window.
He is a little light for a sumo wrestler.
ko: 걔 스모 선수 치고는 몸무게가 좀 덜 나가.

en: He watched the Sumo wrestling with folded arms.
He seems as busy as ever.
He is as busy as ever.
He looks as poor as ever.
He always remained poor.
He is as poor as ever.
He is as kind as ever.
He looks as young as ever.
He's a crybaby, just like always.
He works well, just as usual.
He is as lazy as ever.
He works as hard as ever, but he remains poor.
ko: 걔 여전히 열심히 일하는데도 계속 가난해.

en: He is his usual self.
He still kept on smoking.
He is as talkative as ever.
He has accumulated quite a collection of books.
He has a fairly large fortune.
He has nobody to consult.
He got the better of his opponent.
He knocked his opponent out.
He had a slight edge on his opponent.
I find a good rival in him.
He joined the opposing team.
He received a tremendous punch on the jaw from his opponent.
ko: 걔 상대한테 턱을 엄청 세게 맞았어.

en: He makes it a habit to keep good hours.
He kept early hours.
He is in the habit of keeping early hours.
ko: 걔 일찍 자고 일찍 일어나는 게 습관이야.

en: He is a fast speaker.
He believed in getting up early in the morning.
ko: 걔는 아침 일찍 일어나는 게 좋다고 믿었어.

en: He makes a habit of waking up early.
ko: 걔 일찍 일어나는 걸 습관처럼 해.

en: He is used to getting up early.
He wakes up early.
He gets up early.
He's an early bird.
He is an early riser.
He tried to get up early.
He makes nothing of getting up early in the morning.
ko: 걔 아침 일찍 일어나는 거 아무렇지도 않게 생각해.

en: He promised me to come early.
He was impatient to see his daughter.
ko: 걔 자기 딸 보고 싶어서 안달 났었어.

en: He started to go to bed early.
He arrived too early.
He went to bed early.
He went to bed early but did not go to sleep until almost 2 in the morning.
ko: 일찍 누웠는데 새벽 2시 다 돼서야 잠들었어.

en: He advised an early start.
He left early; otherwise he could not have caught the train.
ko: 일찍 나갔어. 안 그랬으면 기차 못 탔을 거야.

en: He did not get up early.
He does not get up early.
He was granted permission to leave early.
He was granted permission to go home early.
He is very proud of his skill as a pilot.
He used to be an imaginative boy.
He has a rich imagination.
He is working as a security guard at a warehouse.
He attracted votes away from both candidates.
He watched the horse racing through his binoculars.
He watched the horse race with his binoculars.
He watched the horse race using his binoculars.
He is barren of creative spirit.
He practices austerities almost like a monk.
He tried to appeal.
He has poor ability to organize.
He met a nice young man.
He was dropped because of his running mate.
He became a nice young man.
He got up quickly, splashed cold water on his face, brushed his teeth, and shaved.
ko: 벌떡 일어나서 찬물로 세수하고, 양치하고 면도했어.

en: He got up quickly, splashed cold water on his face, brushed his teeth and shaved.
ko: 벌떡 일어나서 찬물로 세수하고, 양치하고 면도했어.

en: He acquired French quickly.
He can bend an iron rod with his hands.
He was suspended from school for a week for bad conduct.
ko: 행실이 안 좋아서 일주일 동안 정학당했어.

en: He's misunderstood because of his vulgar language.
He is content with the simple life.
He seems rough, but at heart he is very gentle.
He was raised by his grandmother.
He resembles his grandfather.
He adores his grandfather.
He is afraid of his grandfather.
He is the picture of his grandfather.
He was educated by his grandfather.
He is burning with love of his country.
He betrayed his country.
He did his best to rescue her.
He did his best only to fail again.
He gives work all he's got, and gets more work done than anybody else.
ko: 일에 모든 걸 쏟아부어서 누구보다 일을 많이 해.

en: He used all his strength to crawl out of the wrecked car.
ko: 박살 난 차에서 나오려고 온 힘을 다해 기어 나왔어.

en: He ran at full speed.
He was driving the car at full speed.
He tried with all his might to lift the box.
He ran as fast as his legs could carry him.
He drove his sports car at full speed.
He headed for the door at full speed.
He didn't study at all.
He never seems to grow older.
ko: 걔는 진짜 안 늙는 것 같아.

en: He is anything but honest.
He didn't speak to me at all.
ko: 걔 나한테 말 한마디도 안 했어.

en: He doesn't watch television at all.
He doesn't watch TV at all.
He didn't explain it at all.
ko: 걔는 그거 설명을 하나도 안 해줬어.

en: He went heart and soul into the work.
ko: 걔 그 일에 온 힘을 다 쏟았어.

en: He was covered with mud from head to foot.
He was covered in mud from head to foot.
He was an example of a popular athlete in his days.
He gave body and soul to his job.
ko: 걔 자기 일에 온몸을 다 바쳤어.

en: He is attention itself.
He is giving his whole attention to that.
ko: 걔 거기에 온 신경을 다 쓰고 있어.

en: He was covered all over with paint.
He was covered with bruises.
He consumed all his income on drinking.
ko: 걔 번 돈 술 마시는 데 다 썼어.

en: He sustained an injury which will take a month to heal completely.
ko: 걔 다 나으려면 한 달은 걸리는 부상을 입었어.

en: He handed over all his property to his son.
He is said to have lost all his money.
He lost his all.
He lost everything he owned.
He risked losing all his fortune.
ko: 걔 전 재산을 잃을 뻔한 위험을 무릅썼어.

en: He put all his fortune in the enterprise.
ko: 걔 그 사업에 전 재산을 다 쏟아부었어.

en: He had got nationwide fame.
He has got well, so that he can work now.
ko: 걔 이제 다 나아서 일할 수 있어.

en: He has fully recovered and can already work again.
He has completely recovered and can go back to work.
ko: 걔 몸 다 나아서 복직할 수 있어.

en: He won the prize for excellence in all subjects.
He did well in all subjects, particularly mathematics.
ko: 걔 전 과목 다 잘하는데 특히 수학을 잘해.

en: He ordered that everybody get up at six.
He's perfect at everything.
He attributed everything to himself.
ko: 걔는 모든 게 자기 덕분이라고 했어.

en: He was in favor of equality for all.
He broke with all his relatives.
He used all his wealth for the benefit of the poor.
ko: 걔 자기 재산을 가난한 사람들 돕는 데 다 썼어.

en: He is quite capable and can hold his own.
ko: 걔 꽤 능력 있어서 어디 가서든 기 안 죽어.

en: He assumed a new identity.
He said it was out of the question.
He felt utterly humiliated.
He is every bit a politician.
He seems to be bankrupt of all tender feeling.
ko: 걔는 따뜻한 감정이라곤 눈곱만큼도 없는 것 같아.

en: He denies himself nothing.
ko: 걔는 하고 싶은 건 다 하고 살아.

en: He arrived quite out of the blue.
He did not speak at all.
He was left all alone in the woods.
He is quite a savage.
He was not at all satisfied with the result.
ko: 걔 결과에 전혀 만족 못 했어.

en: He is far from honest.
He is a good boy, and what is better, very handsome.
He is the epitome of goodness.
He is not so stupid as to be unable to tell right from wrong.
ko: 걔는 옳고 그름도 못 가릴 만큼 바보는 아니야.

en: He meditated on the problem of good and evil.
ko: 걔는 선과 악의 문제에 대해 깊이 고민했어.

en: He can't tell right from wrong.
He cannot tell right from wrong.
He can't distinguish vice from virtue.
He is old enough to tell good from evil.
ko: 걔도 이제 선악을 가릴 만한 나이가 됐어.

en: He doesn't know the difference between right and wrong.
ko: 걔는 뭐가 옳고 그른지 차이를 몰라.

en: He seized on the unprecedented opportunity.
ko: 걔는 전례 없는 기회를 꽉 잡았어.

en: He lost the watch which he had bought the day before.
It seems that he is a promising youth.
ko: 걔 참 유망한 청년인 것 같아.

en: He is a promising young man.
He has a bright future.
He said a few words by way of preface.
He concentrated on his study of prepositions.
He was sent into combat.
He decided neither to advance nor to retreat.
ko: 걔는 나아갈지 물러날지 결정을 못 내렸어.

en: He was elected to the Senate in the last election.
He amassed a fortune in stock trading during the last boom.
ko: 걔 지난 호황기에 주식으로 돈을 엄청 벌었어.

en: He is better off than he was.
He sent his luggage in advance.
He arrived at nine in accordance with a prearranged plan.
He doesn't study as hard as he used to.
ko: 걔 예전만큼 공부를 열심히 안 해.

en: He said that he had met her on the previous day.
ko: 걔 그 전날 그녀를 만났었다고 하더라고.

en: He gave the same answer as before.
He has been to Switzerland before.
ko: 걔 전에 스위스 가본 적 있어.

en: He is prepossessed with an ill opinion.
He is not old enough to vote.
ko: 걔는 아직 투표할 나이가 안 됐어.

en: He fought a successful election campaign.
ko: 걔 선거 운동 아주 성공적으로 했어.

en: He was chosen by election.
He won the election by a large majority.
It is apparent that he will win the election.
He is fighting with his back to the wall in the election.
ko: 걔 이번 선거에서 배수의 진을 치고 싸우고 있어.

en: He saved a sailor.
He wanted to go to sea.
He became a sailor.
He had heard stories about an ancient god who had left his land centuries before by ship.
ko: 걔는 수세기 전에 배를 타고 떠난 고대 신의 이야기를 들었어.

en: He fell overboard and was drowned.
He is delicate.
He was baptized a Catholic.
He was wounded in the fight.
He has never really got over malaria he caught in the East during the war.
ko: 걔 전쟁 때 동양에서 걸린 말라리아가 아직도 안 나았대.

en: He presented an argument for the war.
He was wounded in the war.
He lost two sons in the war.
He gambled on the war coming to an early end.
ko: 걔는 전쟁이 일찍 끝날 거라는 데 도박을 걸었어.

en: He cheated death many times on the battlefield.
ko: 걔 전장에서 여러 번 죽을 고비를 넘겼어.

en: He demonstrated his courage by his actions in battle.
He was killed in the war.
He is believed to have been killed in action.
He was slain in battle.
He is a war orphan.
He accumulated a tremendous fortune during the post war.
ko: 걔는 전쟁 끝나고 엄청난 재산을 모았어요.

en: He got across the river.
He crossed the river.
He swam across the river.
He went fishing in the river.
He lives across the river.
He sat at the edge of the stream.
He sat next to the stream.
He fell into the river.
He walked along the river.
He drowned while swimming in the river.
He is swimming in the river.
He drowned in the river.
He has excellent techniques which would outdo a specialist.
ko: 걔는 전문가 뺨칠 정도로 기술이 뛰어나요.

en: Since he is not an expert, his opinion is no account.
ko: 걔는 전문가가 아니라서 걔 의견은 중요하지 않아요.

en: He transferred to the office in Chiba.
ko: 걔는 지바에 있는 사무실로 전근 갔어요.

en: He is an absolute monarch.
He took out a 1,000-yen note from his wallet.
ko: 걔는 지갑에서 1,000엔짜리 지폐 한 장을 꺼냈어요.

en: He is the man you met the other day.
ko: 걔가 저번에 네가 만났던 그 사람이에요.

en: He is a born poet.
He came back home a while ago.
He made a fool of his teacher.
He ran off to meet his teacher.
He made much of his teacher's advice.
ko: 걔는 선생님 조언을 아주 중요하게 여겼어요.

en: He followed the lead of our teacher.
He made notes of the teacher's lecture.
He pays no attention to the teacher.
ko: 걔는 선생님 말씀에 전혀 신경 안 써요.

en: He never pays much attention to what his teacher says.
ko: 걔는 선생님이 하시는 말씀을 전혀 귀담아듣지 않아요.

en: He tried to write down everything the teacher said.
ko: 걔는 선생님이 하신 말씀을 다 받아 적으려고 했어요.

en: He will present a book to his teacher.
He studied the harder because he was praised by his teacher.
ko: 걔는 선생님한테 칭찬받아서 공부를 더 열심히 했어요.

en: He made a polite bow to his teacher.
He had an intense hatred of his teacher.
I'm of the opinion that he should apologize to his teacher.
ko: 제 생각에는 걔가 선생님께 사과해야 할 것 같아요.

en: He seems not to be cut out for teaching.
ko: 걔는 가르치는 일에 소질이 없는 것 같아요.

en: He's not cut out for teaching.
He asked his teacher stupid questions.
ko: 걔는 선생님한테 바보 같은 질문들을 했어요.

en: He stuck out his tongue at his teacher.
He studied all the harder for being praised by his teacher.
ko: 걔는 선생님한테 칭찬받아서 훨씬 더 열심히 공부했어요.

en: He made up his mind to be a teacher.
He had no thought of becoming a teacher.
ko: 걔는 선생님이 될 생각은 아예 없었어요.

en: He bowed to his teacher.
He asked his teacher several questions.
ko: 걔는 선생님한테 질문을 여러 개 했어요.

en: He was respected both as a teacher and as a man.
Is he a teacher?
He was given a gold watch by the teacher.
He believes it to be an honor to follow in his predecessor's footsteps.
ko: 걔는 전임자의 뒤를 잇는 걸 영광으로 생각해요.

en: He was out of town last week.
ko: 걔는 지난주에 어디 좀 가 있었어요.

en: He seems to have been sick last week.
He quit school last week.
He managed to get himself promoted last week.
He intended to have visited the temple last week.
He went to America last week.
He moved to Tokyo last month.
He divorced his wife last month.
I hear he has been ill since last month.
He set out for Paris last month.
He is said to have won the speech contest last month.
He earned as much as 100,000 yen working part-time last month.
He uses a pencil with a fine point.
The urge to brag on his recent successes was irresistible.
ko: 걔는 최근에 잘된 일을 자랑하고 싶어 안달이 났어.

en: He changed trains at Sendai Station.
He does not live in Sendai.
His life is despaired of.
He lost hope and killed himself by taking poison.
He came home in despair.
He gave up the attempt in despair.
He has absolute power.
He never touched wine.
I'm afraid he will never admit his guilt.
ko: 걔가 자기 잘못을 절대 인정 안 할까 봐 걱정이야.

en: He was determined to go, so I decided to do my best to help him.
ko: 걔가 가겠다고 워낙 완강해서, 나도 최선을 다해 돕기로 했어.

en: He is obstinate in his opinion.
He has had absolutely no part in the conspiracy; it was not he, but his brother, who had an axe to grind against the government.
ko: 걔는 그 음모랑 전혀 상관없어. 정부에 딴 마음이 있었던 건 걔가 아니라 걔 형이야.

en: He is always saying bad things about others.
He lost his way in the snow.
He was late because of the snow.
His explanation was by no means satisfactory.
He argued away her concern.
I argued him into consent.
By virtue of frugality he has made a fortune.
He is suspected of robbery.
He is easy to get on with.
It seems that he likes collecting stamps.
ko: 걔 우표 수집하는 거 좋아하나 봐.

en: He has collected twice as many stamps as I have.
ko: 걔는 나보다 우표를 두 배나 많이 모았어.

en: He collected a lot of stamps.
He has collected no fewer than five hundred stamps.
He drank a glass of red wine.
ko: 걔 레드 와인 한 잔 마셨어.

en: He did not stop his car at the red light.
He is no better than a baby.
He's just like a baby.
He is a total stranger to me.
He covered himself with shame.
He looked after the baby.
He picked up a red stone.
He decided on a red car.
He wore red pants.
A man of responsibility, he didn't leave the matter alone.
ko: 걔는 책임감이 강해서 그 일을 그냥 보고만 있지 않았어.

en: He has a strong sense of responsibility.
He fixed the blame on his friends.
He's a take-charge boss.
He was appointed to a responsible post.
He's active doing charity work.
ko: 그는 봉사 활동을 활발하게 하고 있어요.

en: He is famous as an oil king.
He made a fortune in oil.
He is said to have made a fortune in oil.
He broke the window by throwing a stone.
He threw a stone into the pond.
He weighed the stone in his hand.
ko: 그는 손에 든 돌의 무게를 가늠해 봤어요.

en: He threw a stone at a dog.
He picked up a stone.
He remained silent like a stone.
ko: 그는 돌처럼 아무 말 없이 가만히 있었어요.

en: He used to be a man of fortune.
He used to be a quiet man.
He is better off than he used to be.
He is less healthy than he used to be.
He is not as well off as he used to be.
He is not so diligent as he used to be.
He does not work so hard as he used to.
He doesn't work as hard as he used to.
He used to drink.
He told me how he had once been a rich man.
He used to be a nice boy.
He used to be a gentleman.
He is not the cheerful man he was.
He must have gone to see his old friend.
ko: 그는 옛 친구를 만나러 갔나 봐요.

en: He is different from what he used to be.
He is not what he used to be.
It is said that he has a lot of old coins.
ko: 그가 옛날 동전을 많이 가지고 있대요.

en: They say that he has a lot of old money.
ko: 그가 옛날 돈을 많이 가지고 있대요.

en: He looks like a completely different person to what he was before.
ko: 그는 예전이랑 비교하면 완전 딴사람 같아요.

en: He's always been kind to me.
He once lied and told her a rare creature lived in her closet.
ko: 그는 예전에 그녀의 옷장에 희귀한 생물이 산다고 거짓말을 한 적이 있어요.

en: He is immune from taxes.
He prefers the quiet.
He lives in peace.
He walked quietly.
He quietly knocked at the door.
He quietly knocked on the door.
He made a motion to be silent.
He told us to keep quiet.
He put his finger to his lips as a sign to be quiet.
ko: 그는 조용히 하라는 뜻으로 입술에 손가락을 갖다 댔어요.

en: He loves to hike in the quiet countryside.
ko: 그는 조용한 시골에서 하이킹하는 걸 좋아해요.

en: He has a lot of books for the young.
ko: 그는 젊은이들을 위한 책을 많이 가지고 있어요.

en: He was so angry that his veins stood out.
ko: 그는 너무 화가 나서 핏대가 섰어요.

en: He lost color.
He thinks that blue is the most beautiful color.
ko: 그는 파란색이 가장 예쁜 색이라고 생각해요.

en: He has blue eyes and fair hair.
ko: 그는 파란 눈에 밝은 색 머리예요.

en: He has blue eyes and blond hair.
He had a blue jacket on.
He was dressed in blue.
He has a blue coat on.
He protested that he was innocent.
He devoted himself whole-heartedly to her.
ko: 걔는 그녀한테 온 마음을 다 바쳤어.

en: He has a reputation for integrity.
He likes Western culture.
He is bent on becoming a vocalist.
ko: 걔는 성악가가 되려고 기를 쓰고 있어.

en: He sang with his voice strained.
He dropped his voice.
He shouted at the top of his voice.
He has a loud voice.
He acted like a saint.
He's dying to see Seiko.
ko: 걔 세이코 보고 싶어서 죽으려고 해.

en: He is an energetic politician.
He was mentally troubled.
He checked out of the hotel.
He did his best but soon saw that he could not compete with such a fast runner.
ko: 걔는 최선을 다했지만 그렇게 빠른 주자랑은 경쟁이 안 된다는 걸 곧 깨달았어.

en: He is by nature a generous person.
He is still fully active.
He is endowed with a sense of humor.
He is a poet by birth.
He insured himself.
He even referred to the origin of life.
He challenged the mountain at the risk of his life.
